content:
Is there anything else that should be changed in #17499?
@Eric Wieser @Joseph Myers
#17499 hasn't had any more comments for a while. Can this go on the queue? I'd like to have it for a lemma on Jacobi symbols...
@Scott Morrison Thanks! I've made the simplification.

Thanks for putting this on the queue. However, there is a problem now: int.is_unit_iff was moved to file#data/int/units in the meantime, which is not imported by file#data/list/big_operators.

How best to resolve this? Would importing file#data/int/units from file#data/list/big_operators be OK? Or would it be better to set up a separate file for neg_one_mem_of_prod_eq_neg_one?

As far as I'm concerned data.list.big_operators is still a big pile of junk with uncontrolled imports, that we really should carve up into pieces. But in the meantime, sure, go ahead, it can't get much worse. :-)
OK; I interpret this as saying I should just include the now missing import. I'll do that some time later today.
This is now done, and CI was happy with it. So it could be put back on the queue again.
Fwiw, if you need someone to tell bors to merge the pr, it should be "awaiting-review" so it's included in the #queue; a bot will replace it with "ready-to-merge" once it gets r+ again
Thanks; I'll try to remember that for the future. (The "ready-to-merge" label was not removed automatically by the "r-" action. Is this intended?)
